meshTags: Lymphoma, Primary Cutaneous Anaplastic Large Cell
meshMinor: Lymphoma, Primary Cutaneous Anaplastic Large Cell
abstract: Anaplastic large cell lymphomas (ALCL) are characterized by large, pleomorphic cells with a strong expression of cytokine receptor CD 30. We present a 71-year-old patient with several nodules on the right temple extending to his right ear. Based on clinical, histological and immunophenotypic criteria, the diagnosis of a primary cutaneous CD30(+) ALK(-) anaplastic large cell lymphoma was made. After local excision and adjuvant radiotherapy no relapse occurred during a follow-up period of three months.
title: [Primary cutaneous CD30+ ALK(-) anaplastic large cell T-cell lymphoma].
